Links: [Adjusting Imports of Aluminum and Steel Into the United States](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/06/09/2025-10524/adjusting-imports-of-aluminum-and-steel-into-the-united-states)

Tariff action: Trump announces deal with China on Truth Social;  no legal details provided: After two days of talks between US and Chinese negotiators in London, President Trump posts on Truth Social, “OUR DEAL WITH CHINA IS DONE, SUBJECT TO FINAL APPROVAL WITH PRESIDENT XI AND ME.” No details of any legal agreement are provided and it appears there are no changes in tariffs. Trump also states, “FULL MAGNETS, AND ANY NECESSARY RARE EARTHS, WILL BE SUPPLIED, UP FRONT, BY CHINA,” presumably addressing US concerns over Chinese export restrictions on rare earth minerals announced earlier this year.
Links: [Truth Social Post](https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/114664632971715644)

Trump announces tariff agreements with Japan and Philippines on Truth Social: President Trump posts that he has reached tariff agreements with the Philippines and Japan. The next day, the White House publishes a fact sheet for the US-Japan Strategic Trade and Investment Agreement.


Legal details and the timeline for tariff changes under those agreements were not immediately provided.
More details on Indonesian trade agreement: The White House announces and provides a fact sheetfor a framework for negotiating an agreement on reciprocal trade that will include the US modifying the tariff it announced on April 2, 2025, to 19 percent (previously 32 percent). Note: The formal deal was not yet agreed and legal details were unavailable.

Tariff action:
Trump announces tariff agreement with South Korea on Truth Social: President Trump posts an agreement with South Korea that specifies a 15 percent tariff on goods exported to the United States. Legal details and the timeline for tariff changes under the agreement were not immediately provided.
Copper tariffs will begin on August 1: The White House issues a proclamation imposing a 50 percent tariff on imports of copper under Section 232 of the Trade Expansion Act of 1962 effective August 1, 2025.
Duty free treatment for de minimis ends for all countries: The White House issues an executive order and fact sheet suspending the de minimis exemption granting zero tariffs to low value shipments from all countries.
Brazil tariffs and a new national emergency: The White House issues an executive order and fact sheet declaring a new national emergency and invoking the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) to impose an additional 40 percent tariff on Brazil starting seven days after the date of this order. The US Department of Treasury also sanctions Brazilian Supreme Federal Court justice Alexandre de Moraes for “politicized prosecutions,” including against former President Jair Bolsonaro.

Tariff action:
Tariffs adjusted on nearly all countries: With respect to the “reciprocal” tariffs imposed under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) announced on April 2, 2025, the 90-day extension for their application on April 9, and the further extension on July 7, the White House issues an executive order and fact sheet further adjusting the rates for countries with which it has and has not concluded a bilateral agreement over the prior month. Tariffs on Canada increased to 35 percent for USMCA noncompliant goods: The White House issues an executive order increasing the tariffs on imports from Canada to 35 percent for products that do not comply with the USMCA rules of origin, effective August 1, 2025, under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA).
